summary: Several companies may be selling health insurance in a given market, but, as we previously reported , most people usually enroll with one of a small number of insurers. Known as market concentration, this can result in higher premiums due to less competition in the market. We found this pattern continued through 2018, with the markets for individuals and for small employers seeing an increase...
title: Private Health Insurance: Markets Remained Concentrated through 2018, with Increases in the Individual and Small Group Markets
